generated_question: I don't understand how to locate the billing information on my bill. What are the key terms I need to understand to know my account balance and get information about my bill's due date?
ground_truth_response: You can locate your billing information on your monthly bill. The bill summary will give you important customer information such as the bill issued date, payments received, outstanding balance, current billing period charges, and any late charges applied if the bill is not paid by the due date (plus grace days). It will also display the previous balance, the previous payments received, the BGE outstanding balance, electric charges, gas charges, and other charges and credits, which may include Smart Energy Rewards, service contract billing information. The total amount due by the due date will be displayed, and the electric and gas details will give you a breakdown of the charges, annual usage profile, meter reading details, current billing period, rate schedule, KWH (usage), and therms (usage). If you have any additional inquiries, BGE.com or the BGE Mobile App can be used to view bills and make payments.

generated_question: How can I lower my energy bill during the winter months?
ground_truth_response: To lower your energy bill during the winter months, you can take several steps. These include setting your thermostat to a lower temperature when you're not at home or when you're asleep, using a programmable thermostat to manage heating more efficiently, sealing any air leaks in your home, ensuring your home is properly insulated, using energy-efficient heating sources, and using curtains or blinds to keep heat in during the night.
user_response: To lower your energy bill during the winter months, you can set your thermostat to a lower temperature when you're not at home or when you're asleep. You can also use curtains or blinds to keep heat in during the night.

generated_question: What should I do if my electricity goes out?
ground_truth_response: If your electricity goes out, you should first check if the outage is only in your home or if it's a widespread issue. You can do this by checking your circuit breaker or fuse box. If the outage is only in your home, you can try resetting the breaker or replacing the fuse. If the outage is widespread, you should contact your electricity provider to report the outage. They can provide you with information about the outage and an estimated time for restoration.

generated_question: What should I do if my gas appliance is leaking?
ground_truth_response: If you suspect that your gas appliance is leaking, you should immediately turn off the gas supply to the appliance. You should also open windows and doors to ventilate the area. Do not operate any electrical switches, appliances, or telephones in the area where you suspect the leak. Leave the area and contact a qualified technician to inspect and repair the appliance.

generated_question: What should I do if I smell gas in my home?
ground_truth_response: If you smell gas in your home, you should immediately leave the area and avoid using any electrical switches, appliances, or telephones. Do not light any matches or candles, as these can ignite the gas. Once you are safely away from the area, contact your gas provider or emergency services to report the leak.
